dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Found in a small stream, Nan Kywe Chaung, up to 30 m wide but not very deep, about 1 m in the low water season; water colorless and clear, current moderate, surroundings consisted of secondary forest and pasture, the bank with grasses; with long-leafed submerged plants (Cryptocoryne) growing in clumps whose bottom consisted of sand and pebbles (Ref. 46238).  Maximum length reported, 6 cm TL and 5 cm TL for female (Stefan, pers. comm. 05/05).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. and R. Britz 2002 Revision of the family Badidae (Teleostei: Perciformes), with description of a new genus and ten new species. Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 13(4):295-372. (Ref. 46238)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 15 - 17; Dorsal soft rays (total): 8 - 10; Analsoft rays: 7 - 8; Vertebrae: 26 - 29

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. and R. Britz 2002 Revision of the family Badidae (Teleostei: Perciformes), with description of a new genus and ten new species. Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 13(4):295-372. (Ref. 46238)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Dentary pores 1-2; infraorbital pores 3-4; lachrymal pores 2; extrascapular pore 1.  Caudal fin base with a prominent dark spot at the center, surrounded by a light ring.  Differs from B. pyema in having a deeper body, depth 32.5-39.4% (versus 26.3-32.7); fewer lateral line scales, 25-26 (versus 27-28); fewer vertebrae, 26-29 (versus 28-29); and color pattern.  Males are overall dark with a brown spot on each scale on sides.  No dark blotch on cleithrum, opercular margin, nor on dorsolateral side of caudal peduncle (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#TrophicStrategy
dataObjects.description: Found in a small stream, Nan Kywe Chaung, up to 30 m wide but not very deep, about 1 m in the low water season; water colorless and clear, current moderate, surroundings consisted with secondary forest and pasture, the bank with grasses; with long-leafed submerged plants (Cryptocoryne) growing in clumps whose bottom consisted of sand and pebbles. In Indawgyi Lake, found in water with abundant vegetation and along the shore. Abundant in the lower part and mouth of the tributary Nant Yen Khan Chaung where there are some current (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
DD
Data Deficient

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Chaudhry, S.

Reviewer/s
Chaudhry, S., Britz, R., Allen, D.J., Datta, N.C., Dey, S.C. & Jha, B.R.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Badis corycaeus is found in streams and in Indawgyi Lake, Myanmar. Its population and range extension needs to be studied properly. It is assessed as Data Deficient as threats to the species, its habitat in Indawgyi Lake need to be further investigated, and the species distribution better understood.
